columns.name: id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the service principal.

columns.name: display_name
columns.description: The display name for the service principal.

columns.name: app_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the associated application (its appId property).

columns.name: account_enabled
columns.description: true if the service principal account is enabled; otherwise, false.

columns.name: app_display_name
columns.description: The display name exposed by the associated application.

columns.name: app_owner_organization_id
columns.description: Contains the tenant id where the application is registered. This is applicable only to service principals backed by applications.

columns.name: app_role_assignment_required
columns.description: Specifies whether users or other service principals need to be granted an app role assignment for this service principal before users can sign in or apps can get tokens. The default value is false.

columns.name: service_principal_type
columns.description: Identifies whether the service principal represents an application, a managed identity, or a legacy application. This is set by Azure AD internally.

columns.name: sign_in_audience
columns.description: Specifies the Microsoft accounts that are supported for the current application. Supported values are: AzureADMyOrg, AzureADMultipleOrgs, AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount, PersonalMicrosoftAccount.

columns.name: app_description
columns.description: The description exposed by the associated application.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Free text field to provide an internal end-user facing description of the service principal.

columns.name: login_url
columns.description: Specifies the URL where the service provider redirects the user to Azure AD to authenticate. Azure AD uses the URL to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Azure AD My Apps. When blank, Azure AD performs IdP-initiated sign-on for applications configured with SAML-based single sign-on.

columns.name: logout_url
columns.description: Specifies the URL that will be used by Microsoft's authorization service to logout an user using OpenId Connect front-channel, back-channel or SAML logout protocols.

columns.name: add_ins
columns.description: Defines custom behavior that a consuming service can use to call an app in specific contexts.

columns.name: alternative_names
columns.description: Used to retrieve service principals by subscription, identify resource group and full resource ids for managed identities.

columns.name: app_roles
columns.description: The roles exposed by the application which this service principal represents.

columns.name: info
columns.description: Basic profile information of the acquired application such as app's marketing, support, terms of service and privacy statement URLs.

columns.name: key_credentials
columns.description: The collection of key credentials associated with the service principal.

columns.name: notification_email_addresses
columns.description: Specifies the list of email addresses where Azure AD sends a notification when the active certificate is near the expiration date. This is only for the certificates used to sign the SAML token issued for Azure AD Gallery applications.

columns.name: owner_ids
columns.description: Id of the owners of the application. The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object.

columns.name: password_credentials
columns.description: Represents a password credential associated with a service principal.

columns.name: oauth2_permission_scopes
columns.description: The published permission scopes.

columns.name: reply_urls
columns.description: The URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in with the associated application, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to for the associated application.

columns.name: service_principal_names
columns.description: Contains the list of identifiersUris, copied over from the associated application. Additional values can be added to hybrid applications. These values can be used to identify the permissions exposed by this app within Azure AD.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: Custom strings that can be used to categorize and identify the service principal.

columns.name: tags
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTags

columns.name: title
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTitle

columns.name: tenant_id
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTenant

columns.name: metadata
columns.description: Metadata of the Azure resource

columns.name: og_account_id
columns.description: The Platform Account ID in which the resource is located.

columns.name: og_resource_id
columns.description: The unique ID of the resource in opengovernance.
